overview: On Easter Day, Marie-Chantal Perron leaves the pharmacy on rue Mont-Royal to go to see friends in the McGill ghetto. On her way, she meets her friend, the actor David La Haye, forced to beg since an accident left him without short-term memory, therefore unable to learn his texts. Alone, without friends or a job, he is very happy to find his old friend, who has some difficult personal decisions to make and who is concerned by the state of his friend's health. As they walk, the two recall good times in their friendship.
title: J'espère que tu vas bien
